title: Spring Framework co-founder and lead Juergen Hoeller on Spring Framework 5.2 and more
description:
Hi, Spring fans! Welcome to another extra-special, extra-long installment of A Bootiful Podcast. In this episode, I talk to Spring Framework lead and #2 co-founder of Spring itself, the one, the only, the amazing Juergen Hoeller. We talk about his tenure as the longest and most prolific contributor to Spring; designing clean code; the early days of Spring the project; new features in Spring Framework 5.2; the role of Kotlin, Project Loom, Graal in the Spring ecosystem; Spring's role in the ecosystem; Java's place and possibilities; and so much more.

  • Juergen on Twitter: @SpringJuergen
  • Spring Framework on Github: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework

title: Gradle Developer Advocate Jenn Strater
description:
Hi Spring fans! In today's installment I talk to Gradle Developer Advocate Jenn Strater about Gradle, Groovy, Spring REST Docs, and so much more.

  • Jenn on Twitter: https://twitter.com/codeJENNerator

title: Rabobank's Roy Braam
description:
Hi Spring fans! In this installment Josh Long talks to Roy Braam, a solutions architect at Rabobank, a bank in the Netherlands, about how they are able to quickly iterate despite regulation and size.

Roy Braam on Twitter: http://twitter.com/rbraam Rabobank: https://www.rabobank.com/en/home/index.html Josh Long on Twitter: http://twitter.com/starbuxman

title: Jon Schneider on his project metrics collection facade Micrometer
description:
In this installment we talk to Jon Schneider, lead of the Micrometer project that supports dimensional metrics instrumentation. It aims to be "SLF4J, but for metrics," and it has already seen uptake in a number of JVM community projects including the RabbitMQ JVM driver and Spring Boot.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/jon_k_schneider Twitter: https://twitter.com/MicrometerIO

Recorded: May 25, 2018 Notes:

  • Check out the Micrometer project http://Micrometer.io

title: Twitter's Chris Thalinger on Java, Graal, JVMs, JITs, Sao Paolo, Hawaii, and more
description:
Hi Spring fans! In this installment of a Bootiful Podcast Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to Twitter's Chris Thalinger (@christhalinger) about Graal VM; JITs; Compilers; Hawaii, USA; Sao Paolo, Brazil; and so much more.

Chris Thalinger on Twitter: @christhalinger GraalVM: https://www.graalvm.org/

title: Go-lang and Kubernetes legend Verónica Lopez
description:
Hi Spring fans! In this episode I talk to Go-lang and Kubernetes-legend Verónica Lopez about community, physics, distributed systems and more.

Verónica on Twitter: http://twitter.com/maria_fibonacci

title: Hibernate community legend Vlad Mihalcea on the project, Hibernate, databases and more
description:
Hi, Spring fans! in today's episode Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to Vlad Mihalcea (@vlad_mihalcea) about Hibernate, databases, optimizations, and more.

title: Oracle's Geertjan Wielenga on his new book "Developer, Advocate!"
description: Hi Spring fans! In this episode, Josh Long (@starbuxman) interviews Oracle's Geertjan Wielenga (@GeertjanW) about his new book (on developer advocacy) "Developer, Advocate!"

title: Dr. Venkat Subramaniam on Kotlin, Java, Spring, open-source, being productive, and so much more
description:
Hi, Spring fans! In today's episode, I talk to the man, the myth, the legend, the good Dr. Venkat Subramaniam on Kotlin, the future of Java, Spring, open-source, being productive and awesome, and so much more.

  • Dr. Subramaniam on Twitter - http://twitter.com/Venkat_S
  • https://twitter.com/starbuxman/status/1103810728883040256 - a tweet asking that whatever recording I do with Dr. Subramaniam for the Bootiful Podcast be longer than an hour (wish granted!)
  • The image from today's episode comes from a joint-talk that the good Dr. Subramaniam and I did in Atlanta, GA for the epic Devnexus conference. I am using the photo from Matt Raible's tweet
  • Dr. Subramaniam's new book Programming Kotlin: https://pragprog.com/book/vskotlin/programming-kotlin

description: Hi, Spring fans! In this episode Josh Long (http://twitter.com/starbuxman) talks to Neo4j's mad scientist, and one of the most brilliant and generous people around, Michael Hunger (http://twitter.com/mesirii), about all things graph, relationships and more.

title: Microsoft's Jialin Dai on Spring for Azure
description:
Hi, Spring fans! Welcome to another installment of "A Bootiful Podcast"! In this installment, Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to Microsoft's Jialin Dai about the various Spring for Azure Spring Boot starters and auto-configuration!

Happy holidays from the @BootifulPodcast team to you!

title: Spring Integration lead Gary Russell on Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, Spring Integration and more
description:
Hi, Spring fans! In this installment, @starbuxman talks to Spring Integration lead Gary Russell about Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, Spring Integration and more.

  • Gary on Twitter: https://twitter.com/gprussell?lang=en

title: Devops luminary and all around great guy John Willis
description: Hi Spring fans! In this week's installment, Josh Long (@starbuxman) talk to DevOps luminary, cloud-computing visionary, and all-around-great-guy John Willis (@botchagalupe). This a white-knuckle rollercoaster ride of knowledge, so buckle up and enjoy!

title: Spring Contributor and "Learning Spring Boot 2.0" author Greg Turnquist
description:
It was a lot of fun to talk to Greg Turnquist, one of the more industrious and variously applied members of the Spring family, about how he found his way to the Spring team and community, Python, his new book, Spring team legends like Keith Donald and Brian Dussault, and so much more.

http://twitter.com/GregTurn http://Spring.io/team/gturnquist

title: Pivotal's Senior Director of Technology Cornelia Davis
description:
Today's interview is with Cornelia Davis, senior director of technology at Pivotal and author of Manning's upcoming, and epic, "Cloud Native." I first met Cornelia when she was working in the office of the CTO at EMC. She took the proverbial plunge and joined the then nascent cloud computing effort, Cloud Foundry, and has never looked back. Corenlia has, over the course of her 30+ years as an engineer, also become a champion for diversity and inclusion in computing.

Twitter: http://twitter.com/cdavisafc Recorded: May 29, 2018 Notes:

  • Her book is available here https://www.manning.com/books/cloud-native

title: Josh Mckenty - "Better Josh" - on data sovereignty, Python, the cloud, Pivotal, and more
description:
Hi Spring fans! In this week's installment of a Bootiful Podcast I, Josh Long, welcome Josh Mckenty - or "better Josh," as I affectionately call him - to the show to discuss Pivotal, Cloud Foundry, Python, microservices, and data sovereignty, among other things.

Josh Mckenty on Twitter: http://twitter.com/jmckenty

title: Codota's Dror Weiss
description:
Hi Spring fans! In this installment I talk to Dror Weiss, CEO of Codota, a company that seeks to make smart code completion in your IDE even smarter.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/drorwe https://www.codota.com/about

title: Matt Raible and James Ward at Devnexus 2019
description:
Hi Spring fans! In this extra-long installment I talk with longtime friends and fellow developer advocates, Okta's Matt Raible and Google's James Ward. We talked about Java, Kotlin, cloud computing technologies, security, Go, paradigm changes, web frameworks past and present, Macromedia, Scala, and a MILLION more things! This was a ton of fun for me so I'm hoping you'll enjoy it too.

Matt on Twitter: http://twitter.com/mraible James on Twitter: http://twitter.com/_jamesward

title: CQRS with AxonIQ's Steven van Beelen and Pivotal's Ben Wilcock
description:
Hi Spring fans! In this week's installment Josh Long talks to AxonIQ's Steven van Beelen, lead of the Axon project, and Pivotal's Ben Wilcock, on CQRS, event-sourcing, event-storming, microservices, Spring Boot and the long camaraderie shared by the Spring and Axon teams

Steve van Beelen: https://twitter.com/smcvbeelen Ben Wilcock: http://twitter.com/benbravo73 Allard Buijze: http://twitter.com/allardbz AxonIQ: https://axoniq.io/

description:

description:

description:

description:

In this installment Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to Nicolas Frankel (@nicolas_frankel) about integration testing, blogging, Kotlin, application security, living on the French/Swiss border, blogging consistently, and much more. It's an interview with one of my favorite voices in the community.

Nicolas on Twitter: http://twitter.com/nicolas_frankel Nicolas' epic blog: https://blog.frankel.ch/

title: "The Phoenix Project" author Gene Kim
description: Hi, Spring fans! In this episode, Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to "The Phoenix Project" and "The Unicorn Project" author Gene Kim (@RealGeneKim) about DevOps, his experience of the industry, IT organizations and a MILLION TRILLION other things. I'd listen to this one first!

title: Joe Grandja on Spring Security 5's OAuth Support
description:
Hi Spring fans! Welcome to another installment of a Bootiful Podcast! This week @starbuxman talks to Joe Grandja who, not coincidentally, just celebrated his third anniversary working on the Spring team! Joe has been instrumental in building Spring Security 5.x and its OAuth client and resource-server support.

Joe's team page: https://spring.io/team/pivotal-joe-grandja Joe on Twitter: https://twitter.com/joe_grandja

title: Google Developer Advocate Ray Tsang
description:
In this episode I talk to my friend and Google Cloud Developer Advocate Ray Tsang on his Twitter handle, technology (Kubernetes, Spring), the Pivotal and Google collaborations, our collaborations, Spring Cloud, Taiwan, Southern California and NYC, and a ton more.

Ray Tsang http://twitter.com/Saturnism

title: Spring Security engineer Ria Stein
description:
Hi, Spring fans! In this installment, Josh Long talks to Spring Security engineer Ria Stein. Ria is a new, but impactful, engineer on the Spring Security team working on things like Josh's beloved lambda DSL.

  • Eleftheria Stein-Kousathana's page on the Spring team roster: https://spring.io/team/eleftherias

title: Spring Tools lead Martin Lippert
description:
Hi, Spring fans! In today's episode Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to Spring Tools lead Martin Lippert (@martinlippert) about his time at Pivotal, and on the Spring team, his work on Spring Tools, and his work on language servers that now serve as the foundational integration for Spring users using Microsoft's Visual Studio Code, emacs and Atom, among other things.

Thanks, dear listener, and Happy Thanksgiving!

  • Spring Tools http://spring.io/tools
  • Martin Lippert's profile page http://spring.io/team/mlippert
  • the Wikipedia description for Thanksgiving https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thanksgiving

description:

title: The Good Dr. Dave Syer
description:
Hi, Spring fans! In this episode, Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to the one, the only, the inimitable, the amazing, my hero, the good Dr. Dave Syer (@david_syer), Spring Framework committer, former Spring Batch lead, former Spring Security OAuth lead, co-founder of both Spring Boot and Spring Cloud, etc. Statistically, if you're using Spring today, you're probably using code he wrote.

  • Dave on Github: https://github.com/dsyer
  • Dave on Twitter: http://twitter.com/david_syer

title: Java Champion and Jetbrains Developer Advocate Mala Gupta
description: Hi Spring fans! In this installment, Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to fellow Java Champion, industry legend, New Delhi JUG leader, author of several books on Java and Java certification, teacher, and @Jetbrains Developer Advocate Mala Gupta (@eMalaGupta) about @Java, learning new features in Java, and more.

description:

description:
Hi Spring fans! This week I'm excited to welcome Sreee Tummidi, a senior product manager working at the intersection of application security and platform at Pivotal. We talked about security, Spring Security OAuth, OAuth, OIDC and OIDC Connect, SAML, and of course the Cloud Foundry UAA, and tons more.

http://twitter.com/sreetummidi https://github.com/cloudfoundry/uaa

description:

Michael Minella on Twitter: http://twitter.com/michaelminella

title: Pivotal Labs Sydney director David Julia
description: Hi, Spring fans! In this installment, Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to Pivotal Labs Sydney director David Julia (@DavidJulia) about applied agile, testing strategy, architecture and more.

description:

Twitter: http://Twittter.com/SpencerBGibb

description:

description:

title: Spring teammate Brian Clozel on new features in Spring 5.2 and Spring Boot 2.2
description:
Hi, Spring fans! In this installment, Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to Spring Boot and Spring Framework engineer Brian Clozel (@bclozel) about all the new features - RSocket support, performance improvements and more - in Spring Framework 5.2 and Spring Boot 2.2.

  • Brian on Twitter: @bclozel
  • Spring Boot on Twitter: @SpringBoot
  • the place to get started with all things Spring: start.Spring.io

title: Kotlin team engineer Roman Elisarov
description:
Hi Spring fans! In today's installment Josh Long (@starbuxman) sits down with Jetbrain's Roman Elizarov (@relizarov). Roman works on the Kotlin team and, among other things, focuses on asynchronous programming with things like coroutines. This interview was a very detailed dive into the opportunities for asynchronous programming for Spring developers using Kotlin, especially in light of the new coroutine support coming in Spring Framework 5.2.

Twitter: Roman Elizarov (@relizarov) A great blog by Sebastien Deleuze on our new support: https://spring.io/blog/2019/04/12/going-reactive-with-spring-coroutines-and-kotlin-flow

title: Spring Boot engineer Madhura Bhave
description:
In this installment of the pod we talk to Madhura Bhave, an engineer on the Spring Boot team who has improved the project in big ways - working on things like security, actuator, OAuth and more - since she moved from her epic run on the Cloud Foundry and UAA teams. We recorded this interview in August of 2018.

Twitter: http://twitter.com/madhurabhave23 Twitter: http://twitter.com/SpringBoot

title: Reactor project lead Stéphane Maldini
description:
Hi Spring fans! This week I'm excited to sit down and talk with mr. Reactive himself, Reactor project lead Stéphane Maldini. In this interview we talk about the history of the reactive programming for Spring, the Reactor project's evolution over time, from then to now and looking forward.

https://projectreactor.io/ http://twitter.com/smaldini

title: Spring Cloud Stream lead Oleg Zhurakousky
description:
In this installment we talk to Oleg Zhurakousky, lead of the Spring Cloud Stream project, an application integration and messaging wonk, and a prolific contributor to Spring Integration. Oleg also has the dubious honor of being one of my oldest friends on the Spring team - poor guy!

Twitter: twitter.com/z_oleg Twitter: twitter.com/SpringCloud

title: Spring mad scientist Andy Clement on AspectJ, SpEL, Eclipse, Graal and more
description:
Hi, Spring fans! In this SpringOne Platform 2019 episode, Josh Long (@starbuxman) interviews Spring mad scientist Andy Clement (@ andy_clement) on AspectJ, SpEL, Eclipse, the new Graal native image feature, being an Iron-Man triathlete, and more.

  • Andy Clement on Twitter: http://twitter.com/andy_clement
  • the Spring Expression Language: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/tree/master/spring-expression
  • AspectJ: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AspectJ
  • the Graal native image feature: https://github.com/spring-projects-experimental/spring-graal-native

description:

  • Katrina's Medium blog https://medium.com/@kvbakas

title: Nicolai Parlog on Java modularity
description:

  • NIcolai's new book: https://www.manning.com/books/the-java-module-system

title: I need to talk about my father, Clark "Bud" Long, who just passed away
description:
Hi, Spring fans. I really wanted to publish an episode this week. But my father, Clark "Bud" Long, passed away yesterday, Wednesday, December 11th, 2019, at 5:45 pm / 17:45.

I'm having a hard time mustering the usual joy I feel when I publish this podcast. So, I will publish another interview next week. I've got more than a dozen already record and ready for the publishing. But this week, I want to talk, if not bawl my eyes out, a little about my dad.

Thanks for indulging me.

title: Oleg Šelajev on ZeroTurnaround, GraalVM, the vJUG and so much more
description:

title: Microsoft's Kushagra Thapar on Spring Data CosmosDB
description:
Hi, Spring fans! In this episode we talk to Kushagra Thapar who is a senior software engineer at Microsoft working on the world-class, and world-wide Azure CosmosDB.

  • Kushagra's LinkedIn
  • The Spring Initializr
  • Azure CosmosDB
  • Azure Spring Cloud
  • Spring Data CosmosDB

title: Spring and Java community member Eddú Meléndez about working in open-source, his journey to Spring and its community, contributing to Spring and more.
description: Hi, Spring fans! This week I rant about push-button simple deployments and then talk to our friend and Spring and Java community member Eddú Meléndez about working in open-source, his journey to Spring and its community, his various contributions to Spring and more.

title: VMWare COO Sanjay Poonen
description: Hi, Spring fans! In this episode Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to industry legend VMWare COO Sanjay Poonen (@spoonen).

title: Jenkins founder and Launchable founder Kohsuke Kawaguchi
description: Hi Spring fans! In today's installment Josh Long (@starbuxman) talks to Kohsuke Kawaguchi (@kohsukekawa) who needs no introduction - one of the original contributors to JAXB, COM4J, and a host of all sorts of other projects, and is the founder and CEO of Launchable. Oh, did I mention he also created Jenkins, the most popular CI server ever?
